result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Douglas John Kleber in court.  Attorney Lauren Stuckert in court for Douglas John Kleber.  Attorney Alexander James Geocaris in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for arraignment. Defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty. Defense requests a status conference to determine case posture. Case remains calendared in Branch 11.
Status conference scheduled for November 22, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Douglas John Kleber in court with Attorney Lauren Stuckert; both appear by video.  Gregg Herman appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: Oak Creek Officer D. Itsines. Court took judicial notice of the defendants prior OWI convictions. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed. Defense requests an arraignment date.  
Per Chief Judge Directive 22-04 effective July 30, 2022, this calendar will be assigned to Judge David Swanson, Branch 11 in Room 316 of the Safety Bldg.  Arraignment scheduled for September 30, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Supervision Report received and filed.  nk

HELD OFF RECORD WITH APPROVAL OF JUDGE FRANKE. 

Off record discussions held. Court vacates indigency hearing scheduled as attorney has been retained. Case set for preliminary hearing. Parties notified.

Adjustment Number: 22A 062102,
Payable Number: 1018053,
Receipt Number: 22RP027339,
Amount: $20.00

Prior: N30W23027 Pineview Circle #6, Pewaukee, WI 53072
Indigency hearing on July 21, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Douglas John Kleber in court.  Abby Rockendorf appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  PARTIES APPEAR BY VIDEO.
Case set for a preliminary hearing. Defendant appears without counsel.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Sanders, Branch 28.   Court orders the case adjourned for CAUSE for an Indigency Hearing.
  
*Per Chief Judge Directive 22-04 effective June 13, 2022, this calendar will be assigned to Reserve Judge John Franke, in Room 608 of the Courthouse.  Indigency hearing scheduled for July 21, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
JusticePoint Supervision Report dated June 2, 2022 - received

Cash bail that was previously posted to remain.
Court orders defendant TO JUSTICE POINT for Level 3 supervision. Defendant to report to JUSTICE POINT immediately upon leaving court.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY to be monitored by drug test. 
IF THE DEFENDANT FAILS TO REPORT A WARRANT WILL BE ISSUED FOR THEIR ARREST.
Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription.
No driving without a valid license.
Defendant waived time limits for Preliminary Hearing.

Defendant Douglas John Kleber in court with attorney Robert J Hampton.  Dax Odom appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Sanders, Branch 28.
Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT DOES NOT QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 3, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 05/12/2022@1:30pm
